title: Pixel phone bootloop?
content:
My phone was on charge the other day, and would randomly stop charging and then start charging again; I assumed nothing of it and guessed the cable was maybe a little bit off. I come back to my phone around (if I recall correctly) an hour later to find it on the startup Google logo screen.

I guessed it maybe crashed, so let it do its thing again. However, it kept doing this, showing a black screen, and then starting again. I then attempted to go into recovery mode, but it failed to boot that initially, and repeating the same results as with a normal boot. After some time, it eventually loaded normally! I put in my password, opened the phone, and after ~30 seconds, it froze and subsequently turned off, and tried to start again.

I managed to get into recovery mode after this, and I did a factory reset. Upon booting, it did the same thing for a few times then showed the "Hello" page. Again, after about 30 seconds, it crashed and repeated the same thing again.

I left it overnight to do this, and when I came in the morning I could set it up; after around a minute from fully setting it up, it crashed again!

I have no clue what this issue is, I got this phone around February 2018, I didn't expect it to die so quickly.
